title: Provincial Court of Manitoba
text:
The Provincial Court of Manitoba () is the <a href="Provincial%20and%20territorial%20courts%20in%20Canada">lower trial court</a> of the <a href="Province%20of%20Manitoba">Province of Manitoba</a>. It has mainly a <a href="criminal%20jurisdiction">criminal jurisdiction</a>, as well as <a href="Limited%20jurisdiction">limited</a> <a href="concurrent%20jurisdiction">concurrent jurisdiction</a> with the <a href="Court%20of%20Queen%27s%20Bench%20of%20Manitoba">Court of Queen’s Bench</a> in matters of <a href="Canadian%20family%20law">family law</a> that originate outside of <a href="Winnipeg">Winnipeg</a>.
It also hears all <a href="Youth%20Criminal%20Justice%20Act">Youth Court cases</a> in the province; all provincial statute cases, such as those under "The Highway Traffic Act" and "<a href="Liquor%20Control%20Act%20%28Manitoba%20ministry%29">The Liquor Control Act</a>"; presides over <a href="Inquest">inquests</a> under "The Fatality Inquiries Act"; and reviews alleged police misconduct under "The Law Enforcement Review Act".
Over 95% of all criminal cases in Manitoba take place in the Provincial Court.
Judges.
Current judges.
Judges of the Provincial Court are appointed by <a href="Order%20in%20Council">Order-in-Council</a> of the Province of Manitoba upon the recommendation of a <a href="judicial%20nominating%20committee">judicial nominating committee</a>, which is composed of the Chief Judge, three citizens appointed by the provincial government, the President of the <a href="Law%20Society%20of%20Manitoba">Law Society of Manitoba</a>, the President of the <a href="Manitoba%20Bar%20Association">Manitoba Bar Association</a>, and a representative of the Provincial Court judges.
Judicial Justices of the Peace.
Judicial Justices of the Peace conduct trials; conduct sentencing hearings under "The Provincial Offences Act", including matters relating to the "Highway Traffic Act"; conduct hearings regarding <a href="Protection%20order">protection orders</a> under "The Domestic Violence and Stalking Act"; consider the issuance of <a href="Search%20warrant">search warrants</a> and <a href="Production%20order">production orders</a>; and consider applications for <a href="judicial%20interim%20release">judicial interim release</a>.
Judicial Justices of the Peace are appointed by the <a href="Lieutenant%20governor%20of%20Manitoba">Lieutenant Governor in Council</a> upon the recommendation of a <a href="Nominating%20Committee">nominating committee</a>.
